text: @ROBANDTHEMOB @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @EnvAgency Explains why Environment Agency don‚Äôt seem to be acting. What is the solution? It‚Äôs a blight on the town. Anyone passing through, seeing the dereliction of Ryecroft then experiencing this awful smell would have a very low opinion of Newcastle-under-Lyme.
RT @EnvAgencyYNE: We have teams out across #Yorkshire checking defences because of rainfall and snow melt, which are keeping river levels h‚Ä¶
@tomriordan @EnvAgencyYNE Yay - and our bins were emptied this morning after the snow üñêüëç to LCC you are the best üòÄ

@LisaMountford1 @sirbernardh @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @EnvAgency Yes, both ! I have investigated in depth the issue, which lies with the rules and regulations on odour emission. I‚Äôm aware it‚Äôs unpleasant, but sadly it‚Äôs not illegal under current licence https://t.co/Mb0MeT7Pee

@DominicCooke12 So we‚Äôre both equidistant from the site ? As I previously stated: I‚Äôm not defending the odour, just stating that it currently falls well within the H4 odour licence of the site, as determined by the @EnvAgency . The video posted by @AaronBell4NUL and @SimonTagg recognises this
